info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:10PM CDT until August 16 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Lincoln IL
info.description:
At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate periods of thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, heaviest near Vermilion Regional Airport. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville, Vermilion Regional Airport, Bismarck and Alvin.
This includes Interstate 74 between mile marker 217 and the Indiana border.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Painter Creek, Jordan Creek, Lick Creek, Vermilion River, Stony Creek, North Fork Vermilion River, Middle Fork Vermilion River, Middle Branch and Windfall Creek.
info.instruction:
Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN VERMILION COUNTY
